channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Huge fly tip causing pests, 23rd August
item.description:
Lorry-size fly tip of disused furniture and household waste. Has been an eyesore on the residential complex for a while. Causing a big uptick in pests now. The whole courtyard of 50-odd flats have to bear the visual and literal pollution. Removal overdo

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Richmond Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on george st bus stop J, 23rd August
item.description:
There is the graffiti on the bus stop J George street bus stop shed glass. Need to remove outside Royal China

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): George Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public areas not cared for, 23rd August
item.description:
Very disappointed to see public green spaces not cared for by the council. This undermines the value of the area and encourages littering and fly tipping. I have reported these ‘abandoned’ areas several times and nothing is done by the council. Compare this to other boroughs where the green spaces are cared and looked after. Please could you arrange for a gardening team to be sent out to sort out these areas - and to upkeep them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Darwin Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wardrobe dumped in street, 23rd August
item.description:
A wardrobe has just been dumped next to our flat, it is blocking cars turning and wheelchair users and cannot be moved. This needs to be removed as it will encourage more fly tipping and is very dangerous to pedestrians and cars

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Darwin Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large flytip on pavement in Goodmead Road, 23rd August
item.description:
There is a large flytip on the right hand side of Goodmead Road just before you come to Glendower Crescent. There is a large ton bag full of carpet pieces and various bags full of builders waste and some old broken furniture.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goodmead Road, Poverest, London

item.title: Rubbish dumped by EATT, 23rd August
item.description:
This new business constantly dumps their refuse and rubbish on the pavement on St Margaret’s Avenue, north side, with High Road. This is a health & safety issue and needs to be addressed properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, St. Margaret's Avenue, Whetstone, London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battle Road, Northumberland Heath, London

item.title: Weeds grown over road name sign, 23rd August
item.description:
At the intersection of Forest Ridge and Kelsey Lane (the unmade part) the road name signs are hidden by tall weeds making it difficult to see that the road continues into the unmade part those unfamiliar with the area. Please can these been taken down as low as possible?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Forest Ridge, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Road Repair Required – Pothole opposite House No 33 / 48 Newly Road, 23rd August
item.description:
A large pothole located on Newlyn Road just after Baltimore place turn. The pothole is situated close to the double yellow lines, as shown in the attached photo taken on 23rd August 2025. This has been recurring issue and have been reported previouly and fixed. This defect poses a safety risk to road users, particularly cars and cyclists, including pedestrians as debris are flying and requires urgent attention and repair to prevent further deterioration.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newlyn Road, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
